intro: Eugenia breedlovei, commonly known as the Hainuapi, is a species of flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and oval-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Eugenia breedlovei is considered a rare and endangered species.
